title: Love Island Australia: Sophie Monk is absent during elimination leaving fans baffled
text:
She's living the high life in Fiji for this year's season of Love Island Australia.

But host Sophie Monk was noticeably absent from Tuesday's elimination, leaving fans of the show baffled.

Instead of waltzing into the villa to deliver the bombshell verdict like in previous episodes, the former Bachelorette's role was replaced by a series of text messages.

And even the show's narrator Eoghan McDermott seemed surprised by Sophie's mysterious disappearance.

As the islanders gathered around the firepit, Eoghan announced his famous phrase, only to be interrupted by Cynthia Taylu shouting: 'I've got a text!'

'Ladies and gentlemen, bring on the Monk,' he began. 'A text? Oh, fair enough. Bring on the text!'

Cynthia was left to reveal that the so-called 'bomb squad' would be broken up as the three intruders faced being evicted.

MIA: Sophie Monk (pictured) was noticeably absent from Tuesday's elimination, leaving fans of the show baffled

Cassie Lansdell was the next original girl in line to receive a text, announcing that one of the girls would stay, while two would be sent packing.

But on social media during Tuesday's episode, some fans of the show questioned the unusual format.

One Twitter user wrote: 'Making the OG girls do Sophie's talk to the "bomb squad'" cracks me up so hard.'

While another said: 'Sophie literally dialling it in tonight is a power move.'

Text message delivery: On social media during Tuesday's fan, some fans of the show were unsure about the unusual format

Unusual: One Twitter user wrote: 'Making the OG girls do Sophie's talk to the 'bomb squad' cracks me up so hard'

And a third fan joked: 'Sophie Monk couldn’t handle coming into the villa just to see Matt [Zukowski] crying two nights in a row.'

Over on her Instagram, Sophie failed to give any hint as to why she didn't appear in the episode.

Instead, she shared the dramatic footage from the previous night's elimination of Irishman Eoghan Murphy.

Where were you Sophie? Even the show's narrator Eoghan McDermott seemed surprised by the host's mysterious disappearance. Pictured: Sophie Monk

Sophie's absence comes despite the fact she is staying on the paradise island throughout filming with her boyfriend Joshua Gross.

And earlier this month, NW magazine reported that Joshua is planning to propose to Sophie in Fiji.

The source claimed the 40-year-old businessman even brought over Sophie's favourite champagne from Australia for the occasion.

Sophie has hinted for the past few months her desire for Joshua to pop the question while on holiday.

Daily Mail Australia has contacted Channel Nine and Sophie Monk for comment.
description: Sophie Monk (pictured with boyfriend Joshua Gross) was noticeably absent from Tuesday's elimination, leaving fans of the show baffled.
authors: Jess Bell For Daily Mail Australia
